abstract: NFL Roundup; Commissioner Roger Goodell announces that he will split disciplinary action and misconduct investigations into two roles; names B Todd Jones, former head of the Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms and Explosives, as chief disciplinary officer, while Lisa Friel would oversee inquiries into drug offenses, domestic violence and other off-field misconduct; other football news noted.
lead_paragraph: Jones, who led the Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms and Explosives since 2011, will discipline players and work with Lisa Friel, who will investigate off-field misconduct.

headline.main: N.F.L. to Hire B. Todd Jones, A.T.F. Director, as Disciplinary Officer
headline.print_headline: Goodell to Split Jobs of Disciplinarian and Misconduct Investigator
